TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
[¶ Vita sancti Albani.]19 Albon.
SEint Albon þe holie Man &punctelev; was here of Enguelonde
Imartred he was for godes loue &punctelev; þoru&yogh; Iesu cristes sonde
Formest he was heþene man &punctelev; and of heþene men he cam
And sethþe, ase ore louerd it wolde &punctelev; he tornede to cristindom
¶ Þe luþere prince þat was þo &punctelev; dioclician
And an oþur þat was al so &punctelev; þat hei&yogh;te Maximian
Cristine men þat huy mi&yogh;hten iwite &punctelev; huy brou&yogh;ten alle to grounde
In eche londe huy lieten heom seche &punctelev; &yogh;ware huy mi&yogh;hten beon i|founde
And to strongue deþe heom duden &punctelev; swiþe manie and fale
huy ne spareden none þat huy mi&yogh;hten finde &punctelev; noþur grete ne smale
¶ A luþur Iustise þat with heom was &punctelev; to enguelonde he cam
To Martri alle cristine men &punctelev; and destruyen cristindom
A clerk, a guod cristine man þat was &punctelev; heorde it telle wide
Of tormens þat huy duden oþur men &punctelev; he ne dorste no long abide
Ake he fleu&yogh; elles&yogh;wodere &punctelev; þat he iMartred nere
To seint Albones house he cam &punctelev; and bad is In þere
¶ Seint Albon, þe &yogh;wile he with him was &punctelev; awaitede and isai&yogh;
hov he was in is oresones &punctelev; boþe ni&yogh;ht and dai&yogh;
he þou&yogh;te þat he was a fol &punctelev; þat he was heþene so longue
he gan to leue on Ihesu crist &punctelev; and cristinedom tafongue
¶ Þe Iustise þane clerk liet seche &punctelev; so þat it was ikud
hou at seint Albones house &punctelev; with him he was ihud
Kni&yogh;htes he sende to fechchen him &punctelev; &yogh;if he ifounde were
To seint Albon huy comen &punctelev; and echsten after him þere.[This v. is written on the margin; v. 256 are spurious.]
huy comen and founden seint Albon &punctelev; and axeden him anon
&YOGH;weþur ani swuch þere were. &punctelev; "for gode," quath þis holie man
"For gode," seide þis guode Man &punctelev; "I nelle it nou&yogh;t forsake
A swuch Man ich am miseolf &punctelev; I nelle eou non oþur take."
¶ "A, þeof," seiden þis luþere men &punctelev; "artþou icome þarto
&YOGH;wane þou wolt for þat strongue þef &punctelev; to deþe beo ido?"
Þis holie man huy bounden faste &punctelev; and to þe Iustise him brou&yogh;te
And tolden him þat he pulte him forth &punctelev; for þat oþur þef þat huy sou&yogh;ten
¶ "Bel ami," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "seie &yogh;wat is þi name
And of &yogh;wat kunne þou art icome &punctelev; þat ore godes dost schuch[r. swuch] schame."
"To þis Axingue," quath seint Albon &punctelev; "ichulle answerie sone
Of &yogh;wat kunne ich am icome &punctelev; luyte þou hast todone
Alban is mi name, iwis &punctelev; and ich honori also
God þat schop alle þing &punctelev; and eueremore wolle do."
¶ "A, traitur," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "artþou icome þarto
I schal don tormenti þi bodi &punctelev; fram heued to þin ho
hastþou ihud þane þef athom &punctelev; þat doth us so muche schame
And pulst forthþ þiself, þo[r. þou] cheitif &punctelev; to deþe in his name
Anoure ore godes, ich rede, anon &punctelev; and heom sacrefise
Oþur ichulle þe tormenti so &punctelev; þat men schullen of þe agrise."
"For nou&yogh;t þou spext," quath Albon &punctelev; "þaraboute þou spillest þi brethþ
Inelle neuere þene deuel honoure &punctelev; for drede of þe dethþ."
¶ Þo was þe Iustise swyþe wroth &punctelev; þane holie man he nam
Nakede, and[al. he] liet him faste binde &punctelev; and &yogh;af him sone is dom
With schourges he made is tormentours &punctelev; leggen on him inowe
On him huy leiden þat huy werie weren &punctelev; and al is bodi todrowe
Þe harde scourgene in is tendre flechs &punctelev; deope gonne wade
Þe more þat huy tormenteden him &punctelev; þe gladdore he him made
[534 added in L.]he þonkede god þat he moste &punctelev; þare for is loue
To þe stat of cristindom &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is torment come
¶ þo þe luþere Iustise isai&yogh; &punctelev; þat it was al for nou&yogh;t
Þat he ne mi&yogh;hte fram Iesu crist &punctelev; for noþing torne is þou&yogh;t
he hiet him lede withoute toun &punctelev; and is heued smite of sone
Iredie weren þe tormentours &punctelev; forto do is bone
huy harleden him wel filliche &punctelev; þat schame it was to se
Forto huy comen to þulke stude &punctelev; þare he scholde imartred be
huy comen to an vrninde brok &punctelev; þere huy mosten ouer wade
[634 added in L.]Þe tormentores woden ouer al abrod &punctelev; and no strencþe þarof ne maden
¶ Ake ore louerd for seint Albones loue &punctelev; dude miracle þere
Anon so þe schrewe tormentores &punctelev; ouer iwade were
For þo þis holie Man to watere cam &punctelev; þat watur him withdrou&yogh;
And ouer þe broke made ane wei &punctelev; druy&yogh;e and clene inou&yogh;
þat he wende ouer also druy&yogh;e &punctelev; ase it alonde were
And euere þat watur bihinden him &punctelev; smot togadere þere
And cam al a&yogh;ein ase it was er &punctelev; þo he cam to londe
Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; hoso him wole onderstonde
¶ þe maister of þe tormentores &punctelev; to &yogh;wam he was bitake
Þo he isai&yogh; þe faire miracle &punctelev; þene deuel he gan fursake
[734 spurious.]And seide he wolde to Ihesu crist &punctelev; al is heorte wende
For þe Miracle þat he þare isai&yogh; &punctelev; þat so fair was and hende
his sweord þat he on honde bar &punctelev; wel feor fram him he caste
And to seint Albones fet he feol adoun &punctelev; and criede him merci faste
Þat he moste for him dei&yogh;e &punctelev; oþur, bote it oþur were
Þat he moste in þe place &punctelev; þene dethþ afongue þere
¶ Opon an hul huy wenden an hei&yogh; &punctelev; ase huy weren asignet to
Þis holie Man seint Albon &punctelev; to þe deþe do
Seint Albon wilnede aftur watur &punctelev; þare ope þe hulle on hei&yogh;
he biheold þat þare ne mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; no watur come þare nei&yogh;
Ore louerd he bad with guode heorte &punctelev; þat he sende is grace
Þat som water moste to him come &punctelev; in þat ilke place
[856 added in L.]Ore louerd heorde is bone &punctelev; þare anonri&yogh;hte
bifore alle þe tormentores &punctelev; in heore alre si&yogh;hte
¶ For þo he hadde iseid is oresun &punctelev; and ore louerd ibede
Þare sprong out of þat hei&yogh;e [hul] &punctelev; a fair welle in þulke stude
Of also guod water ase ani mi&yogh;hte beo— &punctelev; þat &yogh;uyt lastethþ, ich wene
Euere was þo and also nouþe &punctelev; ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte isene
Þis guode kni&yogh;ht þat biliefde on god &punctelev; for þat he sei&yogh; er
Wel more he criede þo on him &punctelev; for þulke miracle þer
And wilnede &yogh;eorne þat he moste &punctelev; for him dei&yogh;e þere
So þat in ore louerdes name &punctelev; Imartrede boþe huy were
¶ Ake þe tormentour þat smot of &punctelev; seint Albones heued
Luyte he þorte þarof &yogh;elpe &punctelev; him were betere habbe bileued
For þo he smot of is heued &punctelev; ri&yogh;ht in þulke stounde
his owene ey&yogh;ene out of is heued &punctelev; þare ri&yogh;ht fullen to grounde
Louerd, muche is þi mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; hoso him wole onderstonde
Ase men mouwe bi is wiþerwine &punctelev; godes mi&yogh;hte fonde.[g. m. f. on the mar|gin; puyrliche onderstonde ex|punged.]
Seint Albon imartred was &punctelev; here in Enguelonde
Biside ane toune þat widincestre &punctelev; men cleopeden, ich onderstonde
Þare is nouþe a churche arerd &punctelev; and a gret Abbeye also
Þat men cleopieth seint Albones &punctelev; ase he was to deþe ido
Bidde we &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist &punctelev; and seint Albon wel faste
Þat we moten to þe Ioye come &punctelev; þat euere schal ilaste
